name: Days Inn Palm Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days during the Pacific Life Open and thought it was a good place for the price. It is right next door to the Shilo Inn.
reviews.title: Nice Budget Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked having my own private patio. Other places we stayed at in Palm Springs in previous years did not have private balconies or patios. The fridge in the room is a nice feature, we stopped at grocery store after we got in from the airport and stocked up on food for our stay. The free breakfast at this place is decent, fresh orange juice and coffee and a pastry. I would recommend to buy your own bagels and cream cheese at store, or eat breakfast at the onsite restaurant or Denny's down the street.
reviews.title: Love this Place !!

reviews.text: I would recommend not to get a room with a parking lot view, unless you don't really care about that kind of thing.
reviews.title: Nice budget hotel

reviews.text: The pool and outdoor hot tub are really nice. Pool is larger than at other places we stayed at.
reviews.title: A Visitors' Centre recommendation
Very nice stay - gorgeous pool!
reviews.text: The grounds are well kept and clean. The staff is agreeable.

Me and a friend of mine stayed at the Palm Court Inn for the weekend. Our room was nice, large and very clean. The hotel is rather dated, but it's maintained well. I booked this as a last minute trip and it was the only thing I could get, but it was alot of fun. The pool area was nice, lots of chairs. However the crowd in the hotel was older, or with families... not a bad thing if you are yourself older or have children.
reviews.title: Good budget hotel

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was a bit further from the downtown area than I would have liked, but still a very short drive.
reviews.title: Cute 60's style hotel

reviews.text: Looked scary as we drove in. Found our room to be nice & clean & perfectly situated above the pool/jacuzzi area. Grounds well kept, nice & quiet area. Only complaint was the shower head needed replacing, a few lamps refused to work, porch light was extremely bright & shone directly into your face if lying on the bed (we un-screwed it) & jacuzzi was not as clean as I'd like. "Continental breakfast" was one individually wrapped small sweet roll & small cup of weak coffee. Front desk was very helpful when asked for directions, although I was once told that a particular restaraunt was "just at the end of town", it turned out to be in another city altogether, at least a 1/2 drive. We also found out the hard way that reservations are a must just about everywhere on a weekend night, otherwise you'll find yourself starving with a long wait.
For those with open minds, this hotel sits directly across the street from a very fun gay bar, "Toucans", certainly not to be missed for an entertaining evening.
reviews.title: Good Value - But the Plumbing!
Good place for the money
reviews.text: For the budget minded, I'd recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great Spot! Good Location... Very inexensive
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had a good time. The place was great for the price we paid. We paid under $80 a night during the holiday weekend. The place was clean and had a great pool. The place is not all that modern looking, but for the price I paid, I wasn't complaining. The pool was great. It's a nice big pool and a hot jacuzzi. We spent most of the day in the pool drinking beers and went to the casino at night. The casino is about 2 miles away, or a $10 (tip included) taxi ride away. It's a bit too far to walk, especially in the heat. The hotel also offers a continental breakfast at the restaurant next door. The continental breakfast is just coffee and a pastry, but you can order a full breakfast off the menu. The waffles are great, and so is everything else. We ate there twice and it was delicious both times.
Recommendation:Buffett at the Spa Casino on Saturday night is great..all you can eat king crab legs for about $24.
reviews.title: an economical place to crash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Not bad...

likes.disliked: — the price I paid for 2 phone calls ; room needs some update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location
reviews.title: Typical budget motel with a nicer pool area.

reviews.text: clean rooms
reviews.title: I looooooved my stay here!!!!!

likes.liked: — BUDGET hotel that was clean and had a great pool area!
likes.disliked: — Not much to complain about in my opinion.

reviews.text: We just stayed here for two nights and found it really good value at £45 a night. It's about one mile from the centre of palm springs so you really need a car if you intend to spend time in the restaurants, bars etc of palm springs.
reviews.title: clean, comfortable and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was clean and very comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly and the pool area was lovely. Room was a good size with a fridge and microwave. They give a coffee and pastry for breakfast if you want it in a restaurant next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Unacceptable

reviews.text: Would definately recommend for a good value hotel.
reviews.title: Don't Bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for 3 nights, but only stayed 1. I was there on a chilly evening, and the room heater would not work, leaving the temperature very cold and uncomfortable. The bed was hard as a rock. The room was not great, but okay, but the bathroom definitely needed work. The toilet was a bus-station model, with the exposed chrome workings and long handle, and it sounded like a hurricane when it flushed. The toilet was also in the way of the bathroom door, so it wouldn't open all the way. The shower tiles were crumbling and there was no actual showerhead, so water sprayed all over when it was turned on. When I tried to voice my displeasure to the office staff, they weren't interested. I will not be going back.
reviews.title: honeymoon weekend

reviews.text: Not good. Booked the family room, which had one bedroom. The door to the room was all banged up and painted over, the dresser looked like termites had been eating away at it, and the sliding door (we were on the first floor) was very rickety and not very secure at all. So, we went to the front desk and got a refund; their rate was $136 per night. Then we drove down the road to the Hyatt, which charged $169 per night. Where would you rather stay?
reviews.title: Lovely Getaway!

description: Located near downtown Palm Springs, close to Palm Springs Aerial Tramway, shops, Restaurants and Casino. Spacious rooms with balcony, patio, free wireless internet, and free parking.Enjoy our Olympic size pool, childrens wading pool, hot-tub,business center,guest laundry, and fitness room. Local favorite Rick's Restaurant on-site. We also have 3000 sq. feet of meeting and banquet space available.
